answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Your gluten test results do not point towards Celiac disease. No you should not have any gluten specific antibodies ideally. Also anti reticulin antibodies in not considered to be a sensitive and specific test.You should rule out IBS, Crohn’s and Ulcerative colitis. With a history of insulin resistance and miscarriage, please rule out polycystic disease of the ovary.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Thanks for your message.  I don't have PCOS as I was told that I ovulate regulaly (me cycles are regular) and my hormones were checked all good.  The only thing found at the endocrinologist's was that my thyroid perodase antibodies were extremely high in the 1,000's (ref range 0-35).  My TSH, T4 and T3 are fine and I have been taking synthroid for the past 12 years.  I don't have ANY diarrea EVER  so those other GI problems wouldn't be related to my problems or would they?I keep being told that I have slow motility... I don't believe that to be the case.What do you think?

HiYou probably have Hashimoto’s thyroidits. This can also result in constipation too. Yes slow gut motility too is possible. Diabetes and hypothyroidism are the commonest causes of this. Please consult an endocrine specialist and maybe your problems will be managed better. IBS too can present in a similar way with constipation instead of diarrhea. Also keep a food stress diary to see whether any particular type of food causes more problems.Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
